requirement_tested: A frontend application that fetches all data from backend APIs
user_persona: An employee named Sarah who needs to check her attendance records.
user_goal: Sarah wants to view her attendance history by logging into the system and navigating to the history section.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing the Application
narrative_steps.description: Sarah opens the attendance tracking website and sees a login page with fields for username and password.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the root URL of the application.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The frontend loads successfully, displaying the login form styled with papaya whip background and dark orange components.

narrative_steps.title: Logging In
narrative_steps.description: Sarah enters her credentials and submits the form to access her dashboard.
narrative_steps.action: Enter valid username and password, then click the Submit button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Frontend makes an API call to authenticate and redirects to the employee dashboard upon success.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Attendance Records
narrative_steps.description: Once logged in, Sarah navigates to the attendance history tab where she expects to see her records loaded dynamically.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Attendance History' tab within the dashboard.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Frontend fetches data from /api/v1/attendance/history and displays a table of Sarah's attendance records.

requirement_tested: A backend application connecting to a PostgreSQL database using specified environment variables
user_persona: A developer setting up the backend service locally.
user_goal: To ensure the backend connects properly to the PostgreSQL database using predefined environment variables.

narrative_steps.title: Setting Up Environment Variables
narrative_steps.description: The developer configures the necessary environment variables for database connectivity before starting the backend server.
narrative_steps.action: Set DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, DB_USERNAME=myappuser, DB_PASSWORD=myapppassword, DB_NAME=myapp in the backend .env file.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Environment variables are correctly read by the backend application at startup.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Backend Server
narrative_steps.description: Developer runs the backend server to verify connection to the database.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run dev` command in the backend directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Backend server starts without errors and establishes a successful connection to the PostgreSQL database using the provided credentials.

user_persona: An employee named John trying to access his attendance dashboard.
user_goal: John aims to securely log in to the system and gain access to his personalized dashboard.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating to Login Page
narrative_steps.description: John visits the login page which has a clean layout with a centered form.
narrative_steps.action: Open browser and navigate to the login URL.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Login page is displayed with company logo, username and password fields, and a submit button, all styled according to theme.

narrative_steps.title: Entering Credentials
narrative_steps.description: John types in his username and password carefully, ensuring no mistakes.
narrative_steps.action: Fill in the username and password fields.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Input fields accept text entry and do not expose passwords visibly unless hovered over the reveal icon.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting Login Form
narrative_steps.description: After entering his details, John clicks the submit button to proceed.
narrative_steps.action: Click the Submit button or press Enter while focused on either field.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: System validates credentials via the authentication API; if correct, John is redirected to his dashboard.

requirement_tested: Employee clock-in functionality with timestamp recording
user_persona: An employee named Lisa arriving at work early Monday morning.
user_goal: Lisa wants to accurately record her arrival time by clocking in through the system.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Dashboard
narrative_steps.description: Lisa logs into the system and lands on her dashboard, ready to start her day.
narrative_steps.action: Log in as an employee and reach the main dashboard.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Dashboard is displayed with options including a prominent 'Clock In' button.

narrative_steps.title: Clocking In
narrative_steps.description: Seeing the current time displayed, Lisa decides it's time to officially begin her shift.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Clock In' button located prominently on the dashboard.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: System sends a POST request to /api/v1/attendance/clock-in with Lisa’s ID and current timestamp. Button disables after successful submission.

requirement_tested: Employee clock-out functionality with timestamp recording
user_persona: An employee named Mark finishing his workday.
user_goal: Mark intends to log his departure time by using the clock-out feature.

narrative_steps.title: Ensuring Clock-In Record Exists
narrative_steps.description: Before attempting to clock out, Mark confirms he had previously clocked in today.
narrative_steps.action: Check dashboard for presence of active clock-in record.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: 'Clock Out' button is enabled only when a corresponding clock-in exists for the same day.

narrative_steps.title: Clocking Out
narrative_steps.description: Satisfied with his day's work, Mark clicks the clock-out button to end his session.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Clock Out' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: System issues a POST request to /api/v1/attendance/clock-out updating the existing record with the current timestamp.

requirement_tested: Employee dashboard to view personal attendance records
user_persona: An employee named Emma reviewing her monthly attendance.
user_goal: Emma wishes to review her past attendance records organized in a clear table format.

narrative_steps.title: Opening Attendance History Tab
narrative_steps.description: Emma navigates to the attendance history section of her dashboard.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Attendance History' tab.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A sortable table appears showing columns such as Date, Clock-In Time, Clock-Out Time, and Status.

narrative_steps.title: Sorting Records
narrative_steps.description: To find specific entries easily, Emma decides to sort the records by date.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Date' column header.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Table contents reorder chronologically based on selected sorting criteria.

narrative_steps.title: Refreshing Data
narrative_steps.description: Noticing some missing recent entries, Emma refreshes the data manually.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Refresh' button associated with the history table.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Latest data is fetched again from the personalAttendanceHistoryEndpoint and displayed instantly.

requirement_tested: Display of employee's attendance time and absence time
user_persona: An employee named Olivia checking her performance metrics.
user_goal: Olivia wants to understand how much time she spent present versus absent during last month.

narrative_steps.title: Reviewing Summary Metrics
narrative_steps.description: Upon accessing her dashboard, Olivia looks below the history table for summary statistics.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll down to locate the attendance summary cards area.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Summary cards appear showing cumulative values like Total Present Hours, Absent Hours, and Percentage Attendance.

user_persona: An administrator named Robert preparing to oversee team attendance.
user_goal: Robert seeks secure access to administrative features exclusive to his role.

narrative_steps.title: Visiting Admin Login Screen
narrative_steps.description: Robert goes to the dedicated admin login portal designed specifically for privileged users.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the admin login URL.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A separate login interface loads, visually similar to standard login but marked for admin purposes.

narrative_steps.title: Authenticating as Administrator
narrative_steps.description: He provides his administrative credentials and submits them.
narrative_steps.action: Enter admin-specific username and password, then click Submit.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Credentials are validated against the adminAuthAPI endpoint, granting access to the admin dashboard if authorized.

requirement_tested: Admin dashboard to view all employees' attendance records
user_persona: An HR manager named Diana needing an overview of staff attendance.
user_goal: Diana desires a comprehensive view of all employee attendance logs with filtering capabilities.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Full Attendance Logs
narrative_steps.description: As an admin, Diana logs in and accesses the full attendance log viewer.
narrative_steps.action: Log in as admin and navigate to the attendance management section.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Fullscreen grid displays all employee attendance records with headers matching specified column names.

narrative_steps.title: Filtering Records
narrative_steps.description: Wanting more targeted information, Diana applies a filter to narrow down results.
narrative_steps.action: Use dropdown menus to select 'By Department' and choose Marketing.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Grid updates dynamically to show only Marketing department employees’ records retrieved from the allEmployeesAttendanceEndpoint with appropriate query parameters.

requirement_tested: Administrative functionality to perform attendance statistics
user_persona: An operations analyst named Kevin generating weekly reports.
user_goal: Kevin wants to pull statistical summaries about daily attendance trends.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating to Reports Section
narrative_steps.description: Kevin heads to the reporting tab within the admin dashboard.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Reports' tab from the admin navigation menu.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Reporting interface opens with options to configure and generate various statistical outputs.

narrative_steps.title: Generating Statistical Report
narrative_steps.description: He selects a date range and initiates report generation to get key metrics.
narrative_steps.action: Choose a date range and click the 'Generate Report' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: System calls statisticsReportGeneratorAPI and returns calculated metrics like Average Daily Attendance and Late Arrivals Count rendered in charts.

requirement_tested: Administrative functionality to perform attendance analysis
user_persona: A department head named Michelle exploring long-term attendance behavior.
user_goal: Michelle aims to analyze workforce attendance patterns over several weeks.

narrative_steps.title: Entering Analysis Module
narrative_steps.description: Michelle moves to the advanced analysis section to dig deeper into attendance data.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the 'Analysis' section from the admin dashboard sidebar.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Multi-dimensional visualization tools load presenting options for Weekly Patterns, Departmental Trends, etc.

narrative_steps.title: Analyzing Trends
narrative_steps.description: She chooses to focus on weekly patterns to identify recurring behaviors.
narrative_steps.action: Select 'Weekly Patterns' option and initiate data processing.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: analysisEngineAPI is queried and updated visualizations reflect processed trend data accordingly.

requirement_tested: UI styled with papaya whip as base color and dark orange for components
user_persona: A new designer joining the project team evaluating UI consistency.
user_goal: Verify that the entire web application follows the prescribed color scheme throughout.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Global Styles
narrative_steps.description: Designer inspects CSS files and views multiple pages to confirm uniformity.
narrative_steps.action: Open browser DevTools and inspect stylesheets linked globally.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Global stylesheet defines #FFEFD5 as base background and #FF8C00 applied to interactive components across the site.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Component Consistency
narrative_steps.description: Designer checks various UI elements like buttons, forms, and tables to ensure thematic alignment.
narrative_steps.action: Visit different sections of the app (login, dashboard, reports) and observe component styling.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All interactive components maintain consistent dark orange coloring while backgrounds remain papaya whip.

requirement_tested: API endpoints for clocking in and out
user_persona: A QA engineer testing backend clocking functionality.
user_goal: Ensure backend endpoints correctly handle clock-in and clock-out requests with proper validation.

narrative_steps.title: Testing Clock-In Endpoint
narrative_steps.description: QA sends a sample POST request simulating an employee clocking in.
narrative_steps.action: Send a POST request to /api/v1/attendance/clock-in with employee ID and ISO timestamp payload.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Endpoint accepts request, stores the record in the database, and returns a confirmation response.

narrative_steps.title: Testing Clock-Out Endpoint
narrative_steps.description: Next, QA tests the counterpart endpoint for ending shifts.
narrative_steps.action: Issue another POST to /api/v1/attendance/clock-out with matching employee ID and timestamp.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Endpoint updates the existing record with the clock-out time and responds affirmatively.

requirement_tested: API endpoints for retrieving attendance records
user_persona: A mobile app developer integrating with backend services.
user_goal: Fetch paginated and filtered attendance data relevant to individual employees and admins.

narrative_steps.title: Fetching Personal Records
narrative_steps.description: Mobile app calls endpoint to retrieve a logged-in employee's attendance history.
narrative_steps.action: Make a GET request to /api/v1/attendance/history with JWT token in Authorization header.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Returns a paginated JSON array of records belonging solely to the authenticated user.

narrative_steps.title: Fetching All Records for Admin
narrative_steps.description: Same developer now tests fetching collective data accessible only to administrators.
narrative_steps.action: Call /api/v1/admin/attendance/all endpoint with admin-scoped JWT token.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Receives full list of attendance records from all employees respecting pagination support.

requirement_tested: Concurrent development server setup via npm run dev
user_persona: A junior developer joining the team for the first time.
user_goal: Quickly spin up both frontend and backend development environments simultaneously.

narrative_steps.title: Running Unified Development Command
narrative_steps.description: Developer clones the repo and attempts to launch everything with one script.
narrative_steps.action: Execute `npm run dev` from the project root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend servers boot concurrently thanks to concurrently package usage in package.json.
